text.*:
This article needs to be updated. Please update this article to reflect recent events or newly available information. (July 2018)

There are several major university alliances in Taiwan, mostly organized in 2002, intentionally modelled after other university systems such as the University of California. The key steps in such integration may include pooling of resources such as libraries and some co-ordinated budgeting.

Contents

  • 1 Current Alliances
  • 2 Defunct Alliances
  • 3 See also
  • 4 External links

Current Alliances[edit]

Name abbr. Chinese Name Member Universities
Excellent Long-Established University Consortium of Taiwan ELECT 優久聯盟 12 private universities in North.
European Union Centre in Taiwan EUTW 臺灣歐洲聯盟中心 7 comprehensive universities.
Joint Private Medical Universities Admissions System JPMUAS 私立醫學校院聯合招考 6 school of medicine.
Taiwan Comprehensive University System TCUS 臺灣綜合大學系統 4 research universities in South Central.
University System of Taipei USTP 臺北聯合大學系統 4 public universities in North.
University System of Taiwan UST 臺灣聯合大學系統 4 research universities in North.
National Taiwan University System NTUS 國立臺灣大學系統 3 universities in Taipei City: National Taiwan University, National Taiwan Normal University, National Taiwan University of Science and Technology.

Defunct Alliances[edit]

  • Taiwan Joint Normal University System (or Taiwan United Education University System, 臺灣聯合師範大學系統) [1]
  • Taiwan University System (TUS, 臺灣大學系統)
  • University System of Formosa (USFO, 臺灣綜合大學系統)

See also[edit]

  • List of universities in Taiwan
  • Chinese Taipei University Sports Federation

External links[edit]

  • UST Library
